title: See How The Street Fighter Movie Is Embracing Its Ridiculousness In These 40 Images
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                The Street Fighter movie teaser premiered during The Game...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                The Street Fighter movie teaser premiered during The Game Awards, and it looks like the film leans into the series' blend of flashy martial-arts action and larger-than-life characters. Even in quick cuts, the teaser gives fans their first look at familiar faces: Andrew Koji's intense Ryu, Noah Centineo's Ken, and Callina Liang's Chun-Li. There's even Cody Rhodes as Guile doing his trademark somersault flash kick.Alongside the heroes, there are also brief looks at David Dastmalchian's M. Bison being theatrical with a cape flick, Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson's beefy Balrog, and Joe "Roman Reigns" Anoa'i as the terrifying Akuma, looking like he's powering up. There's also Eric Andre as announcer Don Sauvage and professional fighter Alexander Volkanovski as Joe, from the original Street Fighter game.Here, we've created a gallery to give fans a good look at the cast's costumes, but we're still unclear about the movie's plot, so enjoy these spoiler-free images.Street Fighter is scheduled for release on October 16, 2026.

title: Want A Bunch Of Free eShop Games This Holiday Season? Here's How
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          If you want to get your hands...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                If you want to get your hands on nearly a dozen free Switch games this holiday season, now's your chance. Starting today, No Gravity Games is giving away one Switch title per day through December 19, on which day there will be three free games. However, there is a catch that works out in your favor.          To claim a free game on Switch, players need to have claimed the previous day's title and maintained it in their library. You must also have at least one No Gravity title prior to claiming the first freebie, but there's a trick you can use to get that for free, too. Just visit No Gravity Games' official site and sign up for the newsletter, and you'll receive a free game. If you do this first, it will count as a "purchased" game from No Gravity and you're able to then claim the other games for free.If players do miss a day, they can rejoin the giveaway chain by purchasing the previous day's game, which will be available at a greatly reduced price. Each title becomes available for free at midnight PT and they will be available to claim on Nintendo's eShop until 11:59pm PT on the same day.While most of the free games are currently unrevealed, the first one is Bullets & Brains, a top-down arcade-style 3D shooter that pits players against an endless army of the living dead. Wreckin' Ball Adventure, Creepy Tale, Alder's Blood, and Destropolis are all glimpsed in the Switchmas Giveaway trailer above, but not yet confirmed as titles for this year's giveaway.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Activision Calls Season 1 CoD: Warzone's "Cleanest In History" For Anti-Cheat Efforts
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has integrated with Warzone for Season 1, bringing a new Resurgence map, perk changes, and now less hackers to the battle royale. A new post from Activision cites Black Ops 7 Season 1 as being the "cleanest" Warzone launch in history.The publisher says Call of Duty Season 1 launched with the strongest anti-cheat performance Warzone has ever had, and the majority of players are completing their matches without encountering any cheaters.üõ°Ô∏è Call of Duty: #BlackOps7 | Call of Duty: #Warzone A message from #TeamRICOCHET:Season 01 launched with the strongest anti-cheat performance Warzone has ever had. The vast majority of players are completing their matches without encountering a single cheater. This our‚Ä¶  ‚Äî Call of Duty Updates (@CODUpdates) December 12, 2025              "This our cleanest Warzone launch in Call of Duty history," Activision says.In past years, Call of Duty's Ricochet anti-cheat has struggled to keep hackers out of the game, but the team made a few upgrades for the launch of Season 1. The publisher recently outlined Ricochet's major changes, including improved aimbot-detection models and more advanced behavioral detection to stop cheaters early.Activision says this success is also aided by Call of Duty's new TPM 2.0 and Secure Boot requirement on PC, which is implemented for both Black Ops 7 and Warzone.Of course, the battle against cheaters seems never-ending, but the publisher says it remains committed to keeping the bad apples out of the game."We'll keep evolving our defenses, disrupting cheat providers, and protecting fair play so you can stay focused on your matches," Activision says.Sales for Black Ops 7 have faltered compared to previous years, and the publisher has announced a major strategic shift for the Call of Duty series. Despite the changes to come, a Call of Duty movie series is still in the works at Paramount.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
